column1: Sukhinichi (Russian: Сухи́ничи) is a town and the administrative center of Sukhinichsky District in Kaluga Oblast
column3: a large railway junction on the Moscow – Kiev line
column4: situated on the Bryn River 105 kilometers (65 mi) southwest of Kaluga
column5: the administrative center of the oblast. Population: 16

column1: The first historical records of the town date from the first half of the 16th century. It was granted town status in 1840.During World War II
column2: Sukhinichi was occupied by the German Army from October 7
column4: 1942. It has grown mainly due to the development of the railway.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Sukhinichi serves as the administrative center of Sukhinichsky District
column3: to which it is directly subordinated. As a municipal division
column4: the town of Sukhinichi is incorporated within Sukhinichsky Municipal District as Sukhinichi Urban Settlement.
